Reviews.Title: “The only good thing about this place...”
Reviews.Author: Bobadilla
Reviews.Content: ... is the price and the location. I stayed here in November 2008 with my husband on a trip on the cheap to Paris. The place was dirty and falling apart. But hey, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but poor standard”
Reviews.Author: Inake
Reviews.Content: We stayed a few nights at Aviatic hotel and had booked one double room and one tripple room for our family. The location is great in Montparnasse, close to a Metro station and a RER station with connection to Charles de Gaulle airport. It is also a quiet area with little noise during the night. You have free internet in the rooms and tea facilities. Clean sheets and towels changed every day. Limited opening hours for checkin and checkout, closed several hours in the middle of the day and at nights - but this you were informed about in advance by email. The rooms and the bathrooms quite worn, old beds well used, screws sticking up in the floor covered by a thick dirty rug, shower cabin that needs renovation, and only one very cheap soap/schampoo with a broken pump in the shower - fixed so you couldn't move it to the sink. Very low price and matching interior, but it needen't be thilthy.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ChelmsfordLil
Reviews.Content: This was the best value for money I found near Montparnasse, in the centre of Paris. The room was small but clean and newly redecorated. It had all you need in the room, ex. kettle, tea, sugar, toilet and shower. The emplacement is the best. Opposite is a wonderful baker for your croissant and pain au chocolat in the morning. The underground is on the avenue next door... you can go anywhere in Paris very fast. In the evening, there is plenty restaurants around, and, if you do not want to use the transport again, you can take Rue de la Gaité and Montparnasse, and sit at a terrasse, have a drink and watch people passing.

Reviews.Title: “I DON'T recommended Aviatic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eva K
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really cheap, but in this case is better to spend more money or choose hotel not so close to the centre of Paris. The room was very small, but it wasn't the biggest problem, cause bathroom (mainly shower) was absolutely disgusting, there was mold in the corners and not only in the bathroom, in the room too - the carpet was very dirty. Even, last day, we found ants on the room wall! We never come to hotel Aviatic again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place in order to go on a shopping trip”
Reviews.Author: elmasska
Reviews.Content: Nice place and better location ! Ideal to spend the necesary time there. Simple, clean, and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and disgusting.”
Reviews.Author: kinejosefine
Reviews.Content: Me & my sister stayed in Paris for two days in March 2011 at the Hotel Aviatic in Rue Brezin in Montparnasse. Here is a list of things I think you should beaware of I you are considering this hotel: - There was no heat in our room, in march it is still pretty cold in Paris at night so it was freezing in the room. - The bedlinnen was dirty. I slept fully dressed not only because of the cold but also cuz I did'nt want to sleep close to the sheets. - The bathroom was disgusting, and I belive there was some mold in the shower. - The "receptionist" was not very helpfull or friendly. - There is a wierd smell here because of the kitchen next door. This is a very cheap hotel and if you are ok with very low standards and are not planning to spend any time in your room this hotel is OK. Please do not bring children into this hotel, I am afraid of the healthrisks.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, fusty, awful”
Reviews.Author: Ancsipancsi
Reviews.Content: We've got a fusty room (24), the wall was wet and dirty, there was frowsty smell. I can understand that it is a one star hotel, but the cleanness is necessary. No problem with the small room, lack of hotel services, we've needed a nice hotel just for relaxing after a tiring day. The smell was surprising and disappointing that was the worst thing in Paris. Such a dirty, fusty room should not be rented. As we could see the other rooms might be better. I should have refused this room.

Reviews.Title: “Just barely OK”
Reviews.Author: EJ_LIC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because the hotel came highly recommended by a friend who was there 2 months before us. I was a little disappointed by the size of the room and certain staff members. Also, our bath/shower was awful. There was no way to shower without getting a ton of water on our bathroom floor. The front desk person during most of the days we were there was a nice lady - not hotel hospitality nice, but just ok. On our last day, the front desk person was not too friendly, and as we were leaving, we said "Au Revoir" and she just ignored us. Our housekeeper on our first day spoke ZERO English, which is OK 'cuz I don't want to be one of those Americans who expects everyone to speak my language. But shouldn't someone in her line of work understand the word "towel"? Also, when she came into our room to ask if we wanted the room cleaned in French, we gave her this clueless look because we didn't know what she was saying. So she sighed, rolled her eyes, and slammed the door shut. Nice. Also, our room had a TINY room with a toilet, separate from the bathroom which had a sink and bath. Aside from the unsanitary aspect of touching the door handle after using the toilet without getting a chance to wash one's hands, the toilet room is not for one who is even a little claustrophobic. However, this hotel wasn't all bad. Some people, especially the front desk staff at night, were very nice and friendly. The other housekeeping staff besides the woman I described above were all very nice. The beds and pillows were comfy. And, the bathroom was clean (a must for me!). The hotel was also very quiet and peaceful, which is great. Also, I liked the location. It's a short walk from the Montparnasse Metro station, which has a lot of train options. Also, you can walk around for some shopping in the St. Germain area.

Reviews.Title: “just avoid it”
Reviews.Author: aektsis
Reviews.Content: cleanliness: 0 politeness of the staff: 9 old basic furniture tv didn work internet didnt work they say "you get what you pay". Ok, but cleanliness is a basic demand it is a shame, because tha location is good, the street is quiet and not far from center anda main sight seeing, whith just a better cleaning team and the place could be basic but great

Reviews.Title: “A DISASTER !!!”
Reviews.Author: Frenchtraveller35800
Reviews.Content: First of all, my friend and myself stayed in this hotel for 2 nights as we wanted to spend a nice weekend exploring the french capital. My budget being very tight I've checked many website to find the best hotel for us in term of location (close to the airpoirt shuttle stop), price and general appearance. I've also read reviews about it and now, after having experience this hotel, i totally can't understand any positive comment about it ! We arrived quite early, around 12, but the receptionnist (OKAY, I'm not gonna use this word, I'm actually studying Hotel Management and to be honest, the guy at the reception was NOT a receptionist ! I'm really sorry to say that, and don't mean to be rude but he was totally behaving against what i consider as a receptionist)... ok the guy accepted to give us our room which was nice as we arrived early. Then we went through a creepy corridor which led to our room N° 22. Desciption of the room: size : ok cleanliness : a disaster ! ok as I'm working in Hotel Management, I know hotels don't clean the bedspeads every week but PLEASE, once in a while is more than necessary ! We found hairs on the pillow case, hair on the bathroom floor and an UNIDENTIFIED BROWN SUBSTANCE on the shower handle... NO JOKE ! The idea of cleaning the bathroom with Hand sanitizer was actually not the first coming to my mind when I booked it ! Btw, the shower was also covered by mildew... ? ! ? NB: I'm totally not complaining about the housekeeper's job. I actually met her in the corridor and she seemed nice and rather busy. I just want to point out the Hotel Manager's uncapability to rule his business properly ! It seems that there's no breakfast in the hotel as I've never heard about it even during check in. First attracted by the price, I definitely think adding 10 or 15 euros and get a F1 or Ibis room is a wiser choice ! Therefore: I DO NOT ADVICE YOU THIS HOTEL !

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard_in_England
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a clean, safe, BUDGET room, look no further. I got free wireless in my room and nearby are the metro stations, ATMs & a supermarket down the road. What more could I ask for. My room was cleaned daily including the bathroom and the bed made daily. The staff were pleasant and helpful. I've just booked to go back :-)

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel One Couple Can Ever Stay-Beware Room No 24!!”
Reviews.Author: Webster10
Reviews.Content: Hi Guys, This hotel is honestly the worst and the most disgustig hotel one can ever stay in his life, especially the room number 24!! Our room was just near the common tillet and the so called!! kitchen. The kitchen had a disgusting look, so don't ever dare to have a breakfast from here. Some have commented that the breakfast here wa super but believe me, the kitchen scene was unbearable. I saw one of the officials of the hotel once inside the laundry room, where he was just closing his trausers' zip, most probably he had just had a pee in the laundry room. The sheets were lying on the floor where the officials just walked.. This hotel is honestly a dirty and to me a disgusting one. The room 24 was very dark, very dirty bed. And what is worst is the untolerable humidity, moisture in the room. If you stay here for more than 2-3 nights, you would definitely get rheumatics!!Don't ever take your wife or children to here. My wife and I couldn't stand staying there so left before our reservation ended. If you look a bit there are hotels in Montparnasse which have much better service and similar room fee.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the budget consious traveler”
Reviews.Author: AsciiKewl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Aviatic for our recent trip to Paris for DrupalCon. We were a group of 8 on a tight budget. The staff were friendly and were very accomodating with helping with early arrivals and late departures. The area is very nice with everything you need close by. It is right by a metro stop on line 4 that gets you to anywhere central without any fuss, also one metro stop away from the RER B that comes from the airport. The rooms were clean and reasonably sized for budget hotel rooms in Paris. Bathrooms very clean and while small and not too cramped. You can see the owners are on a mission to revamp things. Next on the list should be the beadspreads :) All in all, we had a GREAT stay at a rate we could afford.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend it, great location, great customer service, cleansiness.”
Reviews.Author: VANCBC
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed at the Aviatic hotel in Paris for one week. I cannot even start to tel you what great customer service they had. The man at the desk on our first 3 nights and the one on our last two were outsanding. They were very informative about everything, where to go, where to eat, where to shop, overall knowledge base about everything they were on top of it all. Explaining the metro, greeting us with a smile each time we left and came back. Our rooms were always clean, supplies were always restocked. THe service here was excellent. Our luggage, anything left out was not touched at all. IF we called down for a wake up call we always got the wake up call on time. NO attitude from anyone. Our stay here was excellent, I would recommend this hotel to everyone if they are heading to Paris. Excellent!!!!!! Thank you to the staff at Aviatic Hotel for making our stay very pleasant and will def come back 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Great basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: LabsTimesTwo
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at this hotel -- my husband and I went for a quick 5 day visit to Paris. My criteria for a hotel are clean, quiet and safe. This hotel was all three. We booked their most basic room, so it was quite small with a only view of a small interior garden, but it did have a very comfortable bed and a clean private bathroom with a tub/shower combo. The room was quite adequate for us, since we went out at breakfast for the entire day and didn't come home until late night. There are plenty of cafe and restaurant options around the corner on Rue Montparnesse, and a grocery that you can get premade salads and sandwiches for a picnic. We liked the cafe on the closest corner best for breakfast (oh no, I've already forgotten the name!!) -- anyway the server/bartender is terrific and very friendly. Really the only negative about this hotel is that it is not right next to, or in, a major tourist district -- but everything is a short Metro ride away (the Montparnasse station's entrance is about a 5 minute walk away), or a 20-30 minute walk through neighborhoods. Maybe you want to be closer to the action, but on the other hand, maybe it's nice to get away from the hordes of tourists. Anyway, it really worked out well for us and I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: sarahduck
Reviews.Content: This hotel is for the budget concious traveller, however, if you are going to paris you may like to spend your money on things other than a bed! We stayed here for 3 nights and found it perfectly acceptable, the room was tidy and clean and the bathroom was good with great shower pressure. If you intend to spend time in your hotel and watching television, this is not the place for you (but dare i say, neither is Paris??) If you want somewhere central, close to the metro, close to excellent bars and cafes and wont even touch the sides of your accommodation budget, then this possibly is for you. Literally moments from the catacombs and st Germain and the Latin Qtr.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: RossisGirl
Reviews.Content: I don't think I stayed in the same hotel as some people. I was 3 months pregnant when we stayed here and we had a wonderful time. It was clean, although small andthe breakfast was great! Brilliant location - all we did really was sleep there. Gorgeous weather in October too.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: KACARI
Reviews.Content: My 2 children and I stayed here in March for 4 nights. The staff was very accomodating. The rooms were small but most rooms are in Europe compared to American standards. The hotel is located in a great location to manuver around the city. The metro stop is only a block or 2 away. It is very close to Tour Montropasse which is a must see! We went twice. Once when we first got there during the day and then again on our last night. You can see all of Paris. And seeing the Eifel Tower "sparkle" at night was amazing. We left Paris for a few days to travel to Bayeux and the hotel allowed us to keep our bags that we did not need secured at the hotel until our return. I would highly recommend this hotel and will choose to stay there again when I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “extremely essential”
Reviews.Author: sara2605
Reviews.Content: The room was very small, there was barely enough space between the bed and the wall to pass! Moreover it was not so clean although I met the cleaning lady more than once in a week. Howevere is the cheapest hotel i could find. Another advatage is its location: it is close to the metro station and in the neighbourhood there are restaurants, shops and supermarkets. It's suitable only for a short stay and for who want to spend most time outside.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but...”
Reviews.Author: KGTrip
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the hotel's website. It's too bad they have not put as much effort into maintaining their hotel as they have their webpage. The staff are friendly and responded quickly to questions I had via email. I appreciated the fact that the hotel had free wireless because I was traveling with my laptop but after that the amenities go quickly down hill. The bed sagged terribly and had I needed to spend more than one night in it my back would have suffered greatly! The room was not clean, the TV did not work, the toilet did not work, and the ceiling leaked when the guests above took their shower. When these issues were mentioned to the hotel owner, he seemed nonplussed but said he would look into it. Although cheap, I would have to agree with another reviewer in saying that this hotel is not worth the money you save.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings...”
Reviews.Author: kdig
Reviews.Content: My husband and I used reviews by trip advisor as well as travel guide listings when we chose this hotel for our first trip to Paris in mid September. We had spent just spent four nights in London at a most wonderful hotel and arrived by train lost and confused. We called the hotel and the staff provided great directions to get us there by the Metro. The staff continued to be great with answering questions throughout our stay. All staff were friendly, helpful and willing to assist! Their recommendations (restaurants, transport to De Gaulle,etc.) were most appreciated. The room was another story. While the room was typically European small, the linens, though clean, appeared worn and old. While the hotel atmosphere is quaint and almost vintage, the bedding, carpeting, drapes and curtains should not be. We did not avail ourselves of the breakfast with all the cafes nearby. So location and service most excellent, with room size and presentation average at best for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A good find in an otherwise expensive city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty good. The staff was helpful and quite friendly. The location is pretty good as it is close to a major metro hub. The breakfast at the hotel was as good as two vegetarians can expect it to be! One weird thing: the bathroom and the WC were located separately....a unique and somewhat smelly experience :(...we would most likely not return as we are sure that we can find a better deal next time. But in drastic times, this is not a bad choice at all.

Reviews.Title: “Forget This Place! Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, the rating system cannot go below a 1 or I'd rate it there. This place is the worst place I have EVER been in, going by anyone's standards. My wife and I stayed here for 1 painful night of our 5 night booking. We hardly slept a wink and left as soon as we got up, upgrading to a 4 star hotel. It was worth the extra money. Suffice it to say there was only 1 good thing about this hotel: the free internet in the lobby where we found a better hotel! We feel privileged to have stayed at the Aviatic without catching any diseases, seriously. Oh yeah, and the photos that are on the internet of the place AREN'T REALLY OF THAT HOTEL! IT LOOKS NOTHING LIKE IT! Here is a list of the reasons why we left: - the place uses skeleton keys that are ALL the same. every key opens every door in the place, not very secure. - The stairwell up to the room had NO LIGHTS! It was pitch black and you are walking up a stairway that feels like it is about to collapse. - the room we had was in a tiny hallway that we had to shimmy down, located at the 3rd from top step (remember there were no lights either) - our bed was held together by wires - shower head was broken - shower was FULL of mildew and smelled rotten - the bed wasn't cleaned, sheets had hair all over them - pillows were throw pillows that hadn't been washed in a very long time - the carpet was filthy and didn't even make it to the walls - floor boards were uneven to the point that we tripped on them - there was no handsoap or shampoo - the wallpaper was peeling off the walls - the cups we were given were dirty - there was NO heat in the room, even after we requested it, and the blankets were thin! - we requested a second blanket for the bed because ours was dirty and thin, the new one was taken out of another room and was FILTHY - the dingy courtyard that you had to walk through to get to the dark hall had garbage everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather pay more than stay in this place again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stay there if you have nowhere else to stay; if you can handle sleepin on an old mattress; if you do not mind a tiny radiator set to stop working in the night in winter (!); if you do not mind smell and pong; if you do not mind listening to other people's talk on the other side of the wall; if you do not really care where you stay... if you are easy with everything, you'll be fine there since it's very cheap and well connected with the airport and rest of the town.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: JanToo
Reviews.Content: The room was recently renovated, not too small and clean. The neighbourhood is very nice - a quiet street off the Avenue Général Leclerc, with lots of supermarkets, cafés, restaurants and shops nearby. No breakfast in the hotel, but that's no problem: go to a bakery or café nearby (I recommend the 5€ breakfast at "La Chope Daguerre" at 17, rue Daguerre, or the Café Daguerre on the corner. Minus points: TV in the room, but in my room only on antenna (cable TV outlet did not function); free WiFi internet access is great, but a bit cumbersome because you need to ask for a new login/password every day. Both are minor complaints - I hope to come back here.

Reviews.Title: “hated the aviatic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: God, this hotel is awful!!! The staff is nice enough but it's so dirty and cold here, it's unbelievable. Ok it's cheap but frankly it's not worth the money saved.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Aviatic
HotelInfo.Address: 10, rue Brezin | 14 Arr., 75014 Paris, France
